trans-unit.source: Dash Docs on Heroku (for corporate network that cannot access plotly.com)
trans-unit.target: Dash Docs on Heroku (for corporate network that cannot access plotly.com)

trans-unit.source: Dash Deployment Server speeds your time-to-delivery while providing the right resources, security, and scalability you need to deliver production-quality apps
trans-unit.target: Dash Deployment Server speeds your time-to-delivery while providing the right resources, security, and scalability you need to deliver production-quality apps

trans-unit.source: Dash Design Kit makes your internal dashboard awesome without expertise in JavaScript & CSS.
trans-unit.target: Dash Design Kit makes your internal dashboard awesome without expertise in JavaScript & CSS.

trans-unit.source: Snapshot Engine seamlessly links your analytics and reporting workflows together, giving you a fast way to generate interactive reports of just the data you need
trans-unit.target: Snapshot Engine seamlessly links your analytics and reporting workflows together, giving you a fast way to generate interactive reports of just the data you need

trans-unit.source: Dash is a Python framework for building analytical web applications. No JavaScript required.
trans-unit.target: Dash is a Python framework for building analytical web applications. No JavaScript required.

trans-unit.source: A Python framework for building reactive web-apps. Developed by Plotly.
trans-unit.target: Un marco de Python para construir aplicaciones web reactivas.Desarrollado por Plotly.

trans-unit.source: App
trans-unit.target: App

trans-unit.source: App Samples
trans-unit.target: Muestras de aplicaciones

trans-unit.source: Built on top of Plotly.js, React and Flask, Dash ties modern UI elements like dropdowns, sliders, and graphs directly to your analytical Python code. Read our tutorial proudly crafted ❤️ by Dash itself.
trans-unit.target: Construido sobre Plotly.js,React and Flask,Dash vincula los elementos modernos de la interfaz de usuario,como desplegables,deslizadores y gráficos,directamente a su código analítico Python.Lee nuestro tutorial,realizado con orgullo ❤️ por el propio Dash.

trans-unit.source: Contact and Support
trans-unit.target: Contacto y apoyo

trans-unit.source: Dash
trans-unit.target: Dash

trans-unit.source: Dash app code is declarative and reactive, which makes it easy to build complex apps that contain many interactive elements. Here’s an example with 5 inputs, 3 outputs, and cross filtering. This app was composed in just 160 lines of code, all of which were Python.
trans-unit.target: Dash app code is declarative and reactive, which makes it easy to build complex apps that contain many interactive elements. Here’s an example with 5 inputs, 3 outputs, and cross filtering. This app was composed in just 160 lines of code, all of which were Python.

trans-unit.source: Dash isn't just for dashboards. You have full control over the look and feel of your applications. Here's a Dash App that's styled to look like a PDF report.
trans-unit.target: Dash no es sólo para los salpicaderos.Tienes un control total sobre el aspecto y la sensación de tus aplicaciones.Aquí hay una aplicación de Dash que tiene el estilo de un informe en PDF.

trans-unit.source: Dash uses Plotly.js for charting. Over 35 chart types are supported, including maps.
trans-unit.target: Dash uses Plotly.js for charting. Over 35 chart types are supported, including maps.

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Descripción

trans-unit.source: For companies with software budgets, Plotly offers
trans-unit.target: Para las empresas con presupuestos de software,Plotly ofrece

trans-unit.source: Here’s a simple example of a Dash App that ties a Dropdown to a D3.js Plotly Graph. As the user selects a value in the Dropdown, the application code dynamically exports data from Google Finance into a Pandas DataFrame. This app was written in just 43 lines of code (view the source).
trans-unit.target: Here’s a simple example of a Dash App that ties a Dropdown to a D3.js Plotly Graph. As the user selects a value in the Dropdown, the application code dynamically exports data from Google Finance into a Pandas DataFrame. This app was written in just 43 lines of code (view the source).
